clean_content:
Definition / general

* Mainly in India and Pakistan due to smokeless tobacco / chewing of betel quid* Reactive but risk factor for squamous cell carcinoma* Early lesions show blanching, mottled, marble-like appearance; later fibrous bands lead to stiffness, restricting ability to open mouth (trismus)

Sites

* Buccal mucosa, lips, retromolar areas, soft palate

Case reports

* 10 year old boy and 12 year old girl ([J Indian Soc Pedod Prev Dent 2012;30:85](22565524))* 38 year old man with successful reconstruction using skin graft in buccal mucosa ([Case Rep Dent 2012;2012:628301](23304568))

Treatment

* None, irreversible once it develops* Cessation of quid chewing reduces risk of oral cancer but fibrosis is not altered

Clinical images

Images hosted on other servers:  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityoralsubmucosalfibrosisbiomed01.jpg)](https://lipidworld.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/1476-511X-8-29#Fig1)

Blanching and fibrosis

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityoralsubmucosalfibrosisiarc01.jpg)](https://screening.iarc.fr/atlasoral_detail.php?flag=0⟨=1&Id=A5000007&cat=A5)

With verrucous leukoplakia

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityoralsubmucosalfibrosisclinical1.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3530755/figure/fig1/)
 
[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityoralsubmucosalfibrosisclinical2.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3530755/figure/fig4/)
 
[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityoralsubmucosalfibrosisclinical3.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3530755/figure/fig5/)

38 year old man:   
 preoperative, after suturing graft and 1 year followup

  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityoralsubmucosalfibrosisjisppd01.jpg)](https://journals.lww.com/jped/_layouts/15/oaks.journals/ImageView.aspx?k=jped:2012:30010:00016&i=F1-16&year=2012&issue=30010&article=00016&type=Fulltext)
 
[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityoralsubmucosalfibrosisjisppd02.jpg)](https://journals.lww.com/jped/_layouts/15/oaks.journals/ImageView.aspx?k=jped:2012:30010:00016&i=F2-16&year=2012&issue=30010&article=00016&type=Fulltext)

10 year old boy:   
 difficulty in mouth opening

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityoralsubmucosalfibrosisjisppd03.jpg)](https://journals.lww.com/jped/_layouts/15/oaks.journals/ImageView.aspx?k=jped:2012:30010:00016&i=F3-16&year=2012&issue=30010&article=00016&type=Fulltext)
 
[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityoralsubmucosalfibrosisjisppd04.jpg)](https://journals.lww.com/jped/_layouts/15/oaks.journals/ImageView.aspx?k=jped:2012:30010:00016&i=F4-16&year=2012&issue=30010&article=00016&type=Fulltext)
 
[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityoralsubmucosalfibrosisjisppd05.jpg)](https://journals.lww.com/jped/_layouts/15/oaks.journals/ImageView.aspx?k=jped:2012:30010:00016&i=F5-16&year=2012&issue=30010&article=00016&type=Fulltext)

12 year old girl:   
 shrunken uvula, pretreatment and posttreatment

Microscopic (histologic) description

* Subepithelial fibrosis, chronic inflammation, often with eosinophils, hyalinization and loss of vascularity* Overlying epithelium is atrophic or hyperplastic and hyperkeratotic

Microscopic (histologic) images

Images hosted on other servers:  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityoralsubmucosalfibrosismicro1.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3530755/figure/fig2/)

Dense fibrosis

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityoralsubmucosalfibrosisiarc02.jpg)](https://screening.iarc.fr/atlasoral_detail.php?flag=1⟨=1&Id=histo006&cat=A5)

Advanced
